identified-content.org: Kennedy, John F, Center for the Performing Arts (Washington, DC)

abstract.p: Correction of December 9 article about Kennedy Center Honors which misstated Thomas Jefferson's connection to antique desk at site of award dinner; John Adams, John Jay and Benjamin Franklin, but not Jefferson, signed Treaty of Paris; another signer, David Hartley, was British (S)

block.p: An article on Monday about the Kennedy Center Honors misstated Thomas Jefferson's connection to an antique desk displayed in the State Department's Diplomatic Reception Rooms, the site of an award dinner. While the rooms indeed house the desk at which the Treaty of Paris was signed in 1783, and another desk once owned by Jefferson, he did not sign the treaty. The American signers were John Adams, John Jay and Benjamin Franklin. A correction in this space yesterday included a fourth American erroneously; David Hartley was British.

An article on Monday about the Kennedy Center Honors misstated Thomas Jefferson's connection to an antique desk displayed in the State Department's Diplomatic Reception Rooms, the site of an award dinner. While the rooms indeed house the desk at which the Treaty of Paris was signed in 1783, and another desk once owned by Jefferson, he did not sign the treaty. The American signers were John Adams, John Jay and Benjamin Franklin. A correction in this space yesterday included a fourth American erroneously; David Hartley was British.
